I'm wondering how we can 'bootstrap' a community in a way that isn't "Hey you should leave Reddit and come to Datt" or "Show HN: We're a distributed Reddit/Medium/whatever"...
<@U08BY8MGV|bradkam> has joined the channel

agreed <@U08ERPTQF> that is an important problem. i think community is probably the *hardest* problem of all. <@U08FELZL7> had some excellent ideas about how to do this that hopefully he can share here

I'd like to just narrow in on bitcoin users and show good content. Maybe see if Zapchain would be willing to syndicate theirs. If they post it, they drive traffic to <http://zapchain.com|zapchain.com> and get some money :simple_smile:
<@U08FELZL7|yungdegeneres> has joined the channel

basically we should start by targeting the most relevant communities: 1) disaffected reddit users, 2) people interested in decentralized technologies, 3) bitcoin ... and also other highly related subjects: science, technology, libertarianism
his idea (please correct me if i'm wrong) was to focus more on high quality content rather than funny GIFs
also a subject that keeps coming up is journalis
journalism
this technology may be most useful to amateur journalists who post an awesome story and then actually get paid for their journalism
yup
I love journalism, that’s what I used when I talked about the project to USV, I think maybe a community based on citizen journalism?
and one maybe involving San Francisco news?
good point, SF would be the best place to start with "local journalism" because of the extremely active tech+bitcoin community
other ideas I was brainstorming about would be open source projects, one on torrents maybe
<@U07GDL0H5>: agree. Then there are the potential collaborations with IDEO or Media Lab to broaden the reach to their respective communities.
yes! i love the possible collaborations with IDEO and Media Lab and hope something comes of it
the technology could be great for artists

I’m going to reach out to Shooter…and I’m supposed to be getting an introduction to Imogen Heap who is a fairly popular singer (about 2 million+ twitter followers), she’s getting involved in decentralized tech and working with the Ethereum team <http://www.forbes.com/sites/georgehoward/2015/07/28/imogen-heap-gets-specific-about-mycelia-a-fair-trade-music-business-inspired-by-blockchain/>

attachments.title: Imogen Heap Gets Specific About Mycelia: A Fair Trade Music Business Inspired By Blockchain
attachments.text: Grammy-Award winning Artist, composer, and technologist, Imogen Heap lays out an expansive vision for Mycelia - her concept for how we can utilize the Blockchain to revision the Music Industry in a Fair Trade manner.
attachments.fallback: Forbes: Imogen Heap Gets Specific About Mycelia: A Fair Trade Music Business Inspired By Blockchain

text: she’s the kind of person that would be perfect to help build some of these communities and it wouldn’t cost a thing most likely
awesome!
I think getting 10 communities that we try to build is the best way to start, and maybe go after communities that are on subreddits that have huge problems with mods
Well a large subreddit issue is around AMAs - but I don't think Datt is well placed to solve this
i think if we target any of reddit's commuties, we shouldn't really start with the largest ones. we'd have the most to gain by targeting /r/bitcoin and /r/decentralized and things like that to start
<@U08EZP01H|darrenm> has joined the channel
crazytalk: crowdfund a content bounty
<@U08EZP01H>: that seems to be another perspective on the discussion yesterday about subscribing to authors you like - <https://dattnetwork.slack.com/archives/meta/p1438491020000178>

attachments.fallback: [August 1st, 2015 9:50 PM] paul_xbt: it's a bit like betting that that author's content is going to be awesome
attachments.text: it's a bit like betting that that author's content is going to be awesome

text: perhaps the crowdfunding element is akin to saying "I'm going to post this content on the network soon - who's keen to provide a bounty?"
otherwise once it is posted, anyone could add to the bounty
Hrmm.. yea it's a great meta concept but practically implementing seems tricky
I think any variation of this idea is going to help 'gamify' posting quality content and make for stickier communities
<@U08EZP01H>: agree it's unlikely to be a day 1 feature, but hub & spoke micropayment channels would enable this

another way to build our communities could be putting shared marketing initiatives together with communities, like augur, open bazaar, backfeed. whenever someone has a press release or launch, we all push the same message

We could target smaller bitcoin publications like Newbtc or Cointelegraph. If they post, they make money and drive traffic to their site. We can use good content posted by creators that's already being published elsewhere. This would make our community posters compete with professionals and hopefully less likely to post lower quality content. The professional Poster is even more incentivized to post the best content on Datt because too many down votes could get them banned, a reputation blow that reverberates outside the community. Btc news sites post links for free. We pay them. We would be targeting Reddit consumers initially (r/bitcoin etc), but a slightly different set of Posters.
<@U08BY8MGV>: I like that line of thinking. To build on that idea, we could create on-boarding tools for the publishers we contact. Perhaps that can be done with <@U08ERPTQF> 's IFTTT concept.
I think initially you just tell them to create an account and post. They'll start getting money and traffic without doing anything else.
I've started an <#C08HVDJ4S> channel to expand on ideas to get content in and out of Datt
<@U08BY8MGV>: smaller pubs like cointelegraph might, but it's interesting to think about smoother integrations for larger pubs too
<@U08BY8MGV>: That's a good point. Compared to advertising, this works much better. All day my mind goes back and for between, "How can you grow the community" and "they're getting paid for it!".

I do think we need to be sure not to focus too tightly on related decentralized technologies though, it’s just as important that we get “everyday users” because they are the word of mouth that matters so much
<@U08ELNFTP>: That's huge. If we think we 'only' can go after niches, that self-fulfills anyway.
Also, even more good news. Bitcoin isn't niche anymore. Every major financial publication writes about it all the time

I have some communities that may shock people, but some that really could work (juggalos, conspiracy theorists/godlikeproductions.com type people, former SomethingAwful fans who left when they started charging)
They aren't as interested in other cryptocurrency content though
here’s the thing though, datt really could be a bridge technology to get people into crypto content…. incentivizing reporting and quality content in these scenes with money is something unprecidented
I think there’s enough cool communities we could open up to in both, along with countries with severe censorship issues.
I love this brainstorming and just saying random ideas though, this is usually how great stuff gets noticed!
<@U08ELNFTP>: absolutely agree we need to bridge mainstream publishers/communities into Datt
r/redditalternatives good for some alpha/beta users. not a huge community but they are really enthusiastic about trying new alternatives.

I think compiling a short list of non-traditional journalists and bloggers that would be ideal for the platform would be a good start…. people who would be open to a new way incentivizing, but those who have truly unique and original content (think Nick Szabo but in different fields and genres)
and we provide a platform that demonstrates content can be profitable aside from advertising

Exactly, this is something I have been actively seeking a solution to and this has the best potential of any I have seen. Journalism is so important but so hard now, if the platform is easy enough to use they will use it and that just starts a snowball effect because they are essentially the media
I wonder what it would take to get a Glenn Greenwald involved….
Oooah. Now we're thinking big.
That's an interesting idea.
I have a knack for getting in touch with people that should be way out of my grasp (see guests on my podcast lol)

I am not a specialist on communities, but it would be awesome if we had really unique content that does not exist anywhere else. I once had participated in an EDU unconference and one teacher was describing how he transformed his classroom using Khan Academy’s content. But not the videos, the content was simple apps that helped kids grasp some concept and train themselves on it.
So, small apps, being just JS text, embedded in other content perhaps.
that sounds awesome
<@U08ELNFTP>: following a media conference here, Glenn had to run, but suggested to the audience that he replies to most email questions.
thx, I am thinking about this article a lot: <https://medium.com/@clayallsopp/a-dynamic-crazy-native-mobile-future-powered-by-javascript-70f2d56b1987>
